clinical_study.brief_title: Belimumab In Treatment of Early Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Randomized, Open Label, 52-week Study of Belimumab In Treatment of Early Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the efficacy and impact on B cell subsets of belimumab in early SLE patients(disease duration less than 3 months).

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a single-center, randomized, open label, 52-week clinical trial. All 84 patients will be randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio with the use of standard of care plus Belimumab (at a dose of 10 mg per kilogram of body weight) or standard of care alone.
The primary endpoint is the response rate of SLEDAI in 52 weeks. SLEDAI response was defined as a ≥ 4-point reduction in SELENA-SLEDAI score.

primary_outcome.description: SLEDAI response was defined as a ≥ 4-point reduction in SELENA-SLEDAI score

secondary_outcome.description: the flare of disease during the treatment period will be defined and measured by SLE flare index
Changes in titers of anti-DNA antibody levels
Changes in measures of C3, C4
T cell and B cell subsets
A prednisone dose that was decreased≤ 10 mg/d

arm_group.arm_group_label: Belimumab 10 mg/kg plus standard of care
arm_group.description: Standard of care and Belimumab: 10 mg per kilogram of body weight，days 1 (baseline), 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter to week 52
Standard of care: Steroid(≤1mg/kg/d) with or without proper immunosuppressants which doctors prescribed，including CTX, MMF, AZA, CsA, FK 506, HCQ, MTX, LEF, SASP etc.
